alert.note: Alert for Lewiston Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 4:14PM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A POWERFUL WINTER STORM WILL IMPACT MUCH OF THE REGION ON THURSDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY... .A powerful winter storm will impact much of the region on Thursday into early Friday. This storm will deliver widespread snow which will be heavy over the Cascades and portions of southeast Washington and north-central Idaho. The snow will generally taper off Friday followed by an intrusion of bitter arctic air and dangerously cold wind chill values. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches in the Lewiston-Clarkston Valley and 3 to 8 inches over the higher elevations including in Pomeroy and Gifford. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph could produce areas of blowing and drifting snow over open areas. * WHERE...Alpowa Summit, Lewiston Grade, Gifford, Clarkston, Lewiston, Pomeroy, Culdesac, Peck, and Lapwai. * WHEN...From 4 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
